sn51.17:4.1: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
sn51.17:6.2: multiplying themselves and becoming one again;
sn51.17:6.4: going unimpeded through a wall, an embankment, or a mountain as if through space;
sn51.17:6.5: diving in and out of the earth as if it was water;
sn51.17:6.6: walking on water as if it was earth;
sn51.17:6.7: flying cross-legged through the air like a bird;
sn51.17:6.8: touching and stroking with the hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful;
sn51.17:6.9: controlling their body as far as the Brahmā realm—do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
sn51.17:7.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm … energy …
sn51.17:7.5: “Mendicants, all the ascetics and brahmins in the past,
sn51.17:9.1: or present who wield the many kinds of psychic power—
sn51.17:9.2: multiplying themselves and becoming one again …
sn51.17:9.3: controlling their body as far as the Brahmā realm—do so by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.”
